intro: Cereus pycnacanthus, commonly known as the moon cactus, is a flowering cactus native to South America. It is characterized by its tall, columnar stem and clusters of white or pale pink flowers that bloom at night. The plant has spiny, ribbed stems and is adapted to arid environments. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance. The flowers are typically short-lived but attract nocturnal pollinators such as moths.
